definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Confucius thought it is stupid and hollow saying.
sentences.chinese: 孔老夫子認爲這些都是癡人說夢的空話。

sentences.english: Best of the sport is to do the deed, or shout nothing.
sentences.chinese: 體育運動的好處是隻在乎行動而否則說空話。

sentences.english: Be wise in deed, not word.
sentences.chinese: 聰明見行爲，空話不頂用。

sentences.english: I'm tired of your empty words.
Without judicial review, statutory limits would be naught but empty words.
sentences.chinese: 沒有司法審查，法定權限將只是一句空話。

sentences.english: Of course, if troops had no food, a political director would speak empty words.
sentences.chinese: 如果戰士沒有飯喫，政治指導員當然只能是說空話。

sentences.english: People are always indulging in the empty words to get others support.
sentences.chinese: 那些只會說空話來贏得人們的支持的人。

sentences.english: Forming a good habit of doing more practical things with less empty talk.
sentences.chinese: 養成少說空話，多做實事的良好作風。

sentences.english: This means you're talking high-sounding words or bushwa.
sentences.chinese: 唱高調就是說大話或者說空話。

sentences.english: America's tobacco giants do not think he is blowing smoke.
sentences.chinese: 美國的菸草巨頭並不認爲他是在說空話。

sentences.english: He is all wind. He never actually does anything.
sentences.chinese: 他盡是說空話，實際上什麼事都不幹。

sentences.english: The talk of studying for her Master’s and Ph.D. is just that – talk.
sentences.chinese: 那些她講的關於碩士和博士學位的研究，都只是空話。

sentences.english: You'd better stop this empty talk.
sentences.chinese: 你這些空話還是收起爲好。

sentences.english: Will their good intentions become realities or hollow promises?
sentences.chinese: 他們的好意會變成現實還是成爲空話？

sentences.english: The articles are long-winded and devoid of substance.
